idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.0.1324

descript.abstract: REQUIRED: A brief narrative summary of the data set.
descript.purpose: REQUIRED: A summary of the intentions with which the data set was developed.

citeinfo.origin: REQUIRED: The name of an organization or individual that developed the data set.
citeinfo.pubdate: REQUIRED: The date when the data set is published or otherwise made available for release.
citeinfo.title: Somalia_Settlements_Final_v4_Som

timeperd.current: REQUIRED: The basis on which the time period of content information is determined.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

status.progress: REQUIRED: The state of the data set.
status.update: REQUIRED: The frequency with which changes and additions are made to the data set after the initial data set is completed.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.
theme.themekey: REQUIRED: Common-use word or phrase used to describe the subject of the data set.

idinfo.accconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing the data set.
idinfo.useconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for using the data set after access is granted.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.0.1324
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This dataset contains districts and regional capitals, towns, settlements, and IDP camps.
Below is a description of the fields in the attribute table: OBJECTID - unique ID for the dataset KEMRI_TEAM - team number assigned for the collection of the KEMRI settlements KEMRI_NO_H - number of houses identified by KEMRI surveys KEMRI_POP - population of settlement as identified by KEMRI surveys GTZ_LOCATO - GTZ unique ID for settlements identified in the GTZ survey GTZ_TYPE - type of settlement as identified by GTZ survey GTZ_ECONOM - type of economic activity in settlement as identified by GTZ survey GTZ_POP - population of settlement as identified by GTZ survey GTZ_MINE_A - settlement affected by mines according to GTZ survey DP97_HUTS - number of huts in settlement as identified by UNDP 1997 survey DP97_HOUSE - number of houses in settlement as identified by UNDP 1997 survey DP97_PCODE - place code as allocated by UNDP 1997 survey DP97_CODE - settlement code, identifying type of settlement. 1 = Settlement, 5 = Other town, 10 = District town, 100 = Regional Capital, 1000 = Capital town DP97_SOURC - source of the settlement for the UNDP 1997 survey DP97_PPRES - pre-war population estimate using number of huts for UNDP 1997 survey DP97_PPNRS - pre-war population estimate using number of houses for UNDP 1997 survey DP97_POP - population from topomaps for UNDP 1997 survey DP97_SPOP - surveyed population for UNDP 1997 survey ALT_NAME - Alternative names and spellings for settlement SETTLEMENT - Name of settlement. Where multiple, the name if the latest survey was used and the other names/spellings are listed in ALT_NAME OCHA_ZONE - Zones code as used by OCHA OCHA_STAT - Status code as used by OCHA OCHA_ZNDES - Zone description as used by OCHA OCHA_STDES - Status description as used by OCHA DP06_CODE - place code as used for UNDP 2006 survey DP06_STATU - status of settlement as used for UNDP 2006 survey DP06_EDUCA - availability of education facilities in settlement as per UNDP 2006 survey DP06_HEALT - vailability of health facilities in settlement as per UNDP 2006 survey DP06_MINHH - minimum number of households as per UNDP 2006 survey DP06_MAXHH - maximum number of households as per UNDP 2006 survey DP06_HHSIZ - average household size as per UNDP 2006 survey DP06_MINPO - minimum population as per UNDP 2006 survey DP06_MAXPO - maximum population as per UNDP 2006 survey HCR_REGION - regions as identified by UNHCR HCR_DISTRI - district as identified by UNHCR HCR_SOURCE - source of settlement data for UNHCR HCR_DATE - date of collection for UNHCR HCR_SETT_C - settlement code for UNHCR data HCR_COMMEN - comments on data collected by UNHCR HCR_D_CODE - district code as used by UNHCR HCR_PCODE - place code as used by UNHCR HCR_VRFY - data verification status for UNHCR data DEFINITION - settlement types SOURCE - indicates the data source for the settlement REG_NAME - name of region that the settlement falls in REG_CODE - code of region that the settlement falls in DIST_NAME - name of district that the settlement falls in DIST_CODE - code of district that the settlement falls in

Consts.useLimit:
Please note that settlements in Somalia are not static and settlements move around according to seasons and security situations. Care should be take in using this dataset.
UNDP 2006 population figures have not been included, as this data has not been released by UNDP. When this data is released it can be incorporated by joining on the UNDP 2006 pcode.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.
cntorgp.cntorg: REQUIRED: The organization responsible for the metadata information.

cntaddr.addrtype: REQUIRED: The mailing and/or physical address for the organization or individual.
cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

dataLineage.statement:
This dataset is a collation of settlement datasets available from various sources. These are: United Nations Development Program 1997 settlement survey (UNDP - 1997). United Nations Development Program 2006 settlement survey (UNDP - 2006). Food & Agriculture Organisation - Food Security Analysis Unit - Somalia, FICS database. GTZ - 2002 (German Technical Cooperation) - settlemenet survey of the North and North-East. KEMRI-University of Oxford-Wellcome Trust Collaborative Programme (KEMRI - 2007) - settlement surveys in selected districts for Malaria research and programs. United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA - 2008) - datasets on IDP settlements. United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR - 2008) - datasets on IDP settlements.
These sources were combined and checked for duplicates initially by FAO-Somalia Water & Land Information Management (SWALIM) Project and then completed by Keyobs as pasrt of the RESPOND network.
Settlements referring more than one source in the 'source' field indicates that the settlement has been found in more than one dataset. If the name was similar, and the location similar, then the name and location of the latest survey was used, and the other names has been kept in the 'alt_name' field. In this way duplicate settlements have been eliminated.
As far as possible, all attributes from the various datasets have been maintained.
Please note Pcodes between UNDP 1997 and 2006 surveys, do not correspond. Settlements not found in the UNDP surveys, but found in other datasets, have not been allocated a pcode.
Regions and Districts added via a spatial join operation. These regions and districts correspond to the agreed upon dataset as used by SIMaC and the Statistics Working Group.
